title: Unable to connect to the web on Firefox
content: I am running Firefox 118.0.1 for ARM MacOS, and every site I visit does not work. Instead, I get an "Unable to connect" message, and Firefox is reporting it failed to check for updates. As Firefox worked before running "brew install stats", I suspect that has something to do with it, but I have tried turning my firewall to automatically allow built-in software to receive internet connections, and even tried quitting Firefox. I strongly suspect it is the Stats brew I installed, as browsers normally don't break a week after an update was installed, but quitting Stats doesn't help.
creator: ethan.a.glasby

title: Pages within some websites won't load using Firefox only
content: Statement won't load a 2nd time on credit card site. Stays blank then turns entire computer screen black. Can't open member page at Blue Cross Blue Shield. These work on Edge. Just not on Firefox. Have done all troubleshooting options. Nothing is working. I need your support.
creator: ktbeauf

title: I have old RoboForm and want newest version. Cannot understand how to load new and transfer old to new?
content: I have old RoboForm and want newest version.Cannot understand how to load new and transfer old to new?
creator: lesbaldwin

title: Why is firefox exe running on my GPU ?!!!?
content: WHY IS FIREFOX EXE RUNNING ON MY GPU  ? -- Task manager (Win10x64 22H2) 'processes' shows 7 firefoxes running (task manager 'details' shows 15! with only 3 tabs open); nVidia GPU Activity shows 2 running on my GPU, I don't know whether these are included in these counts or are extra to them. To forestall (hopefully) buck-passing evasions: I'm running an comparativerly old but still working fine 4th gen 4-core (8 threads) i7 cpu with 16 GB RAM, so there should be no reason to HAVE TO tap into the 16GB VRAM. ///WHY/// is firefox running on my GPU at all ?!!???? why so many firefoxes?, why the discrepancy between 'processes' and 'details' ?
creator: xprmt0017a4

title: Strange characters appearing in my bank credit card statements on my desktop, but not on my laptop
content:
When downloading my bank credit card statements on my desktop (but not on my laptop), all the numbers appear in strange characters like hieroglyphics.This also happened about 4-5 weeks ago then corrected. I talked to my bank and after looking at the problem, said it must be a problem with the browser, as it doesn't happen on my laptop or on their review of the statements.


Below is a screenshot example.
creator: hqpl
